questions.question: What is a Datathon?
questions.answer: A datathon is a team-based competition where participants solve real-world problems using machine learning (ML) and data science techniques. It's a great opportunity to collaborate, learn, and apply your data skills in a practical setting.

questions.question: When does the Datathon FME take place?
questions.answer: Datathon FME will be held on November 16th and 17th.

questions.question: I don't have a lot of programming experience. Would you recommend me to participate?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Datathon FME is a great opportunity to learn and grow, regardless of your experience level. We have mentors available to guide and support you throughout the event.

questions.question: What is the price of the event?
questions.answer: Participation at Datathon FME is completely FREE!

questions.question: What should I bring?
questions.answer: Please bring your laptop, charger, and a valid ID. We also recommend bringing toiletries, a sleeping bag, and a mat for overnight stays.

questions.question: Do I need to bring food?
questions.answer: We will provide breakfast, lunch, and dinner on Saturday, as well as breakfast and lunch on Sunday. You can bring your own snacks.

questions.question: What if I have specific dietary requirements?
questions.answer: Don't worry! Indicate it during registration, and we will provide meals suitable for you.

questions.question: Datathon FME is in-person?
questions.answer: Yes, Datathon FME is an in-person event. This format provides a fantastic opportunity to connect face-to-face with mentors, fellow participants, and industry professionals. You can engage in networking, exchange ideas, and build valuable relationships that could benefit your career and learning journey.

questions.question: Can I leave the faculty during the competition?
questions.answer: Of course! You are free to come and go as you please.

questions.question: Can I stay overnight?
questions.answer: Yes. We provide rooms for your rest. We recommend bringing a sleeping bag and a mat.

questions.question: What happens if I arrive late?
questions.answer: If you arrive before [TBC time], head to [TBC location]. If you arrive later, head directly to the School of Mathematics and Statistics. In both cases, please notify an organizer upon your arrival.

questions.question: What happens if finally I can't attend?
questions.answer: If you can't attend, please let us know by sending an email to registrations.datathon@aed.cat . This way, we can offer your spot to someone else.

questions.question: Do you offer travel reimbursement?
questions.answer: We are afraid we cannot cover your travel costs.

questions.question: What prizes will be there?
questions.answer: There will be a prize for each challenge and an additional special prize for rookies, which is aimed at first or second-year university students or high school participants.

questions.question: My participation will be officially recognized?
questions.answer: Upon presentation of their projects, UPC students can earn 1 ECTS. Furthermore, those who request it can obtain an attendance certificate.

questions.question: Who can participate?
questions.answer: Anyone who has been a part of the academic community within the last two years is welcome to join! This includes undergraduate, master’s, and PhD students. Whether you're currently enrolled or graduated recently, as long as you’ve been affiliated with a university in the past two years, you’re eligible to participate.

questions.question: Until what day can I register?
questions.answer: The registration deadline is [TBC]. However, once reached our maximum capacity we might close the registrations sooner. Make sure to sign up as soon as possible to secure your participation.

questions.question: What is the maximum team size?
questions.answer: Teams up to 4 members are allowed.

questions.question: What if I don't have a team?
questions.answer: No worries! You can register as an individual, and we will help you form a team with other participants who are also looking for teammates.

questions.question: What happens if I registered without a team, but now I have one?
questions.answer: You can inform us by sending an email to registrations.datathon@aed.cat

questions.question: What tasks would I do as a volunteer?
questions.answer: You can choose to assist in one or more areas: Pre-event organization, Mentoring and Event Logistics. We would highly appreciate your contribution to the event!

questions.question: Is there any recognition?
questions.answer: If you are a UPC student, you will earn 1 ECTS for volunteering.

questions.question: I am interested in being a sponsor at Datathon FME. What should I do?
questions.answer: Send us an email to sponsors.datathon@aed.cat , and we will help you find a sponsorship that fits your needs.
